com.kuka.med.cyclicbraketest

Interface IBraketestMonitor


  • public interface IBraketestMonitor
    Interface definition of the CyclicBraketestMonitoring capability.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addMonitoringListener(IBraketestMonitorListener listener)
      Adds listener, which will be informed about any change of the monitoring state machine.
      EBraketestExecutionState executeBraketest()
      Starts the brake test for all joints from the current position of the robot.
      EBraketestExecutionState executeBraketest(com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition startPosition)
      Starts the brake test for all joints from the specified position of the robot.
      EBraketestExecutionState executeSingleBraketestOnJoint(int jointId)
      Starts the brake test of the specified joint (0-based) from the current position of the robot.
      EBraketestExecutionState executeSingleBraketestOnJoint(int jointId, com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition startPosition)
      Starts the brake test of the specified joint from the specified position of the robot.
      Map<Integer,EBraketestResult> getBraketestResults()
      Gets a map for all joints of the robot, providing the brake test result, where the index of the joints is 0-based.
      double getJointVelocityRel()
      Gets the configured relative velocity (in % of the maximum joint velocity) for the initial motion before actually executing the brake test.
      long getMonitoringSprId()
      Get the SPR-ID of the CBTM-Monitoring-SPR.
      int getNotificationTime()
      Gets the configured notification time, which defines the time (in seconds) the user is informed in advance before a brake test is overdue.
      Map<Integer,EBraketestResult> getPreviousBraketestResults()
      Gets a map for all joints of the robot, providing the brake test result of the previous cycle, where the index of the joints is 0-based.
      EBraketestMonitorState getState()
      Gets the current state of the cyclic brake test monitoring state machine.

      Sets the acceptable time (in seconds) until a user feedback is required after a due brake test.

    • Method Detail

      • executeBraketest

        EBraketestExecutionState executeBraketest()
        Starts the brake test for all joints from the current position of the robot. The velocity is limited to 20%. It is checked that the current position of the robot is at least 5° from the joint limits, otherwise the brake test cannot be executed.
        Returns:
        EBraketestExecutionState

      • executeBraketest

        EBraketestExecutionState executeBraketest(com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition startPosition)
        Starts the brake test for all joints from the specified position of the robot. The velocity is limited to 20% and can be modified using 'setJointVelocityRel'. It is checked that the start position is at least 5° from the joint limits, otherwise the brake test cannot be executed.
        Parameters:
        startPosition - Position to which the robot will move before executing the brake test.
        Returns:
        EBraketestExecutionState

      • executeSingleBraketestOnJoint

        EBraketestExecutionState executeSingleBraketestOnJoint(int jointId)
        Starts the brake test of the specified joint (0-based) from the current position of the robot. The velocity is limited to 20%. It is checked that the current position of the robot is at least 5° from the joint limits, otherwise the brake test cannot be executed.
        Parameters:
        jointId - Number of the joint (0-based) for which the brake test shall be executed.
        Returns:
        EBraketestExecutionState
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if jointId is out of range

      • executeSingleBraketestOnJoint

        EBraketestExecutionState executeSingleBraketestOnJoint(int jointId,
                                                       com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition startPosition)
        Starts the brake test of the specified joint from the specified position of the robot. The velocity is limited to 20% and can be modified using 'setJointVelocityRel'. It is checked that the start position is at least 5° from the joint limits, otherwise the brake test cannot be executed.
        Parameters:
        jointId - Number of the joint for which the brake test shall be executed.
        startPosition - Position to which the robot will move before executing the brake test.
        Returns:
        EBraketestExecutionState
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if jointId is out of range

      • postponeBrakeTest

        boolean postponeBrakeTest()
        If postponement is possible, the execution is postponed and the timeout reset.
        Returns:
        true if postponement is possible, false otherwise.

      • addMonitoringListener

        void addMonitoringListener(IBraketestMonitorListener listener)
        Adds listener, which will be informed about any change of the monitoring state machine.
        Parameters:
        listener - IBraketestMonitorListener
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if parameter is null.
        See Also:
        removeMonitoringListener(IBraketestMonitorListener)

      • removeMonitoringListener

        void removeMonitoringListener(IBraketestMonitorListener listener)
        Removes listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - IBraketestMonitorListener
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if parameter is null.
        See Also:
        addMonitoringListener(IBraketestMonitorListener)

      • getState

        EBraketestMonitorState getState()
        Gets the current state of the cyclic brake test monitoring state machine.
        Returns:
        current state.

      • getTimeTillBraketestOverdue

        int getTimeTillBraketestOverdue()
        Gets the time (in seconds) till the next brake test is overdue. If a brake test has not been performed or postponed when this value reaches 0, the cyclic brake test monitoring state machine will go into the ERROR state. The return value is always 0 if the current state of the state machine is RUNNING or ERROR.
        Returns:
        time till brake test is overdue [in seconds].

      • isBraketestExecutable

        boolean isBraketestExecutable()
        Gets the flag whether a brake test can be executed. It cannot be executed in state 'FATAL', if the robot is not mastered, if there is insufficient disk space or if the current position is too close to the joint limits.
        Returns:
        true if a brake test is possible, false otherwise.

      • isBraketestExecutable

        boolean isBraketestExecutable(com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition targetPosition)
        Gets the flag whether a brake test can be executed. It cannot be executed in state 'FATAL', if the robot is not mastered, if there is insufficient disk space or if the targetPosition is too close to the joint limits.
        Parameters:
        targetPosition - Position at which the brake test should be executed.
        Returns:
        true if a brake test is possible, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter is null

      • isBraketestPostponeable

        boolean isBraketestPostponeable()
        Gets the flag whether a postponement of the brake test is possible. The postponement is not possible if the initial brake test after booting up has not been executed, yet. Or if the CBTM is in state 'ERROR' or 'FATAL'.
        Returns:
        true if postponement is possible, false otherwise.

      • setNotificationTime

        int setNotificationTime(int time)
        Sets the acceptable time (in seconds) until a user feedback is required after a due brake test. The system checks whether the notification time is shorter than the defined timeouts. If not, the time will be reduced to the minimum of these timeouts. The value accepted by the system is returned. If the notification time is set while a user feedback is already required, the accepted value will not be considered for the current feedback request.
        Parameters:
        time - Acceptable time in seconds.
        Returns:
        The actual notification time accepted by the system.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if time is <= 0.

      • getNotificationTime

        int getNotificationTime()
        Gets the configured notification time, which defines the time (in seconds) the user is informed in advance before a brake test is overdue.
        Returns:
        time the user is informed in advance

      • setJointVelocityRel

        boolean setJointVelocityRel(double relVel)
        Set the joint-specific relative velocity for the initial motion to reach the desired joint configuration for the brake test execution. The default value is 0.2, i.e. 20% of the maximum joint velocity. Please note that joint-specific relative velocity out of the allowed range [0.03, 0.2] will be neglected.
        Parameters:
        relVel - the joint-specific relative velocity of the initial brake test motion (unit %)
        Returns:
        true, if the commanded relative velocity within the allowed range is accepted

      • getJointVelocityRel

        double getJointVelocityRel()
        Gets the configured relative velocity (in % of the maximum joint velocity) for the initial motion before actually executing the brake test.
        Returns:
        joint-specific relative velocity

      • getBraketestResults

        Map<Integer,EBraketestResult> getBraketestResults()
        Gets a map for all joints of the robot, providing the brake test result, where the index of the joints is 0-based.
        Returns:
        enumeration list of the brake test results.

      • getPreviousBraketestResults

        Map<Integer,EBraketestResult> getPreviousBraketestResults()
        Gets a map for all joints of the robot, providing the brake test result of the previous cycle, where the index of the joints is 0-based.
        Returns:
        enumeration list of the brake test results of previous cycle.

      • getMonitoringSprId

        long getMonitoringSprId()
        Get the SPR-ID of the CBTM-Monitoring-SPR.
        Returns:
        SPR-ID
